
::: {.question}

**Convertible Bond — Conversion Value vs. Straight Value (Premium/Discount)**

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
set.seed(807)
ratio        <- round(runif(1, 18, 35), 0)
stock_price  <- round(runif(1, 25, 75), 2)
bond_price   <- round(runif(1, 900, 1250), 2)
conv_value   <- round(ratio * stock_price, 2)
premium      <- round(bond_price - conv_value, 2)



```

A convertible bond can be exchanged for `r ratio` shares. The stock trades at  `r stock_price`  and the bond trades at `r bond_price`.
            
1) What is the conversion value of the bond?  
2) What is the conversion premium (bond price − conversion value)? Use a negative sign if discount.

::: {.question-block}

         data-correct-answer=`r conv_value` data-tolerance="0.5" />
</form>
<div id="feedback-module6_num_q5a" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Conversion value = `r ratio` * `r stock_price` = <strong>`r conv_value`</strong>.

::: {.question-block}

</div>
